page.title: 13Schools & people SW.Cheshire
page.content: The only primary school in the area is the Church of England one at Saighton. Built by the Grosvenor family in 1862 & still rented from them this school is for children of 5 to 11 years.There are 102 pupils & 4 teachers but each day parents help with reading,sewing etc. & there are part-time games & music staff.Very few pupils live in Saighton coming from places such as such as Hatton Heath,but mainly they live outside the area often coming by car,although some use the school bus.Children may also go to schools in Waverton & Chester or to Tattenhall as some in Gatesheath do.Secondary school pupils may go to Abbeygate College at Saighton Grange or they too may go to Chester. Apart from the concentration of old people in Saighton the population is of all ages,dispersed & low in total.
